DOC.brief_summary: Vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine may play critical role colorectal cancer progression . This 4-y study specific aim : 1 ) compare vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine status , oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation subject colorectal polyps colorectal cancer ; 2 ) study effect vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine status oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation colorectal cancer patient ; 3 ) evaluate whether folic acid and/or pyridoxine supplementation beneficial effect oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation patient colorectal ; 4 ) compare vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine status , oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation colorectal cancer patient age- , sex-matched healthy subject ; 5 ) evaluate effect vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine status , oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation risk colorectal cancer ( odds ratio ) ; 6 ) follow effect vitamin B-6 , folate homocysteine status , oxidative stress , antioxidant activity DNA methylation occurrence colorectal cancer ; 7 ) follow effect pyridoxine and/or folic acid supplementation occurrence colorectal cancer . This protocol design hospital-based cross-sectional , case-control , double blind randomize placebo-controlled intervention follow-up trial . Three hundred colorectal cancer patient 300 age- , sex-matched control meet inclusion criterion recruit Taichung General Veterans Hospital . If cancer patient ' plasma pyridoxal 5'-phosphate ( PLP ) level le 30 nmol/L ask participate intervention study blind randomly assign either 1 ) control ( vitamin C , 100 mg/d ) ; 2 ) 50 mg vitamin B-6 ; 3 ) 400 microgram/d folic acid ; 4 ) vitamin B-6 ( 50 mg/d ) plus folic acid ( 400 microgram/d ) 1 year . Data demography , anthropometry , medical history , food frequency questionnaire 24-h diet recall collect . Cancer patient fast blood drawn surgery receive chemotherapy . Additionally , fast blood sample obtain month 0 , 3 , 6 , 9 12 intervention period month 6 , 12 , 18 , 24 , 30 , 36 , 42 48 follow-up .
